page.title: 09Country Park
page.content: Irchester Country Park lies to the south-east of Wellingborough. Originally it was an ironstone quarry and when it was worked out it was planted with trees originally Alder and hazel but later coniferous trees such as Scots Pine and Larch. In 1971 it was bought by the county council to be developed as a country park. The park today provides recreation space for many people living nearby and 414 000 people visited the park in 1983. There are walks of different lengths and degrees of difficulty including a flat walk for the elderly or disabled. The park has marked nature trails for people to follow and has a toilet, room for educational purposes and an office. There are a large number of birds and animals using the park as a refuge including squirrels and some deer.
